How to Install jfractionlab on debian

  • Home
  • debian
  • jfractionlab

Today in this tutorial, I’ll show you how you can install jfractionlab on debian with and without using the command line.

Introduction

Installing jfractionlab on debian is very easy. And with the help of this tutorial, you will be able to easily install, update and uninstall jfractionlab in just a few steps.

In this tutorial I’ll show you four methods to install jfractionlab, the methods are using apt, apt-get, aptitude, and synaptic. All these methods require you to have an active and stable internet connection and sudo permission.

Install jfractionlab Using apt

To install jfractionlab in debian using apt, you will need to run the apt update command first to get the updated list of packages from the repositories.

Copy the command given below and paste it in the command line, then press enter. If you are using the sudo command for the first time then you might also need to enter your root password.

sudo apt update

After you have updated the package list using apt, you can now install jfractionlab using the apt install command. To do that use the command given below.

sudo apt -y install jfractionlab

The installation of jfractionlab might take a little bit of time depending upon your internet connection and machine configuration.

Install jfractionlab Using apt-get

To install jfractionlab using apt-get in debian, you will need to first update the package list using the apt-get update command. Copy, paste, and enter the command given below in the command line.

sudo apt-get update

After updating the package lists, use the apt-get install command given below to install jfractionlab.

sudo apt-get -y install jfractionlab

Install jfractionlab Using Synaptic

To install jfractionlab using Synaptic you will need to first install Synaptic, you can do that by following the instructions from here. After installing synaptic follow the steps below to install jfractionlab on your debian using Synaptic.

You can open synaptic by clicking on the menu icon then searching for synaptic or you can open the command line and enter the command given below –

sudo synaptic

After synaptic opens, click on the search icon and search for jfractionlab. This will display the jfractionlab package in the package window, now to install jfractionlab, click on the checkbox that is on the left side.

Then click on Mark for Installation, this will select the jfractionlab package for installation, now to install it click on the Apply button, you will get a summary window where click on the apply button again to start the download of jfractionlab.

If the download and installation are successful then the checkmark option will turn green.

Install jfractionlab Using aptitude

To install jfractionlab on debian using aptitude, you will need to first install Aptitude in your debian. To install Aptitude follow the instructions here. Once you have aptitude installed proceed to the installation of jfractionlab.

Now you will need to first update your package lists from the repositories, use the apt update command for that, after that update the package list of aptitude using the aptitude update command.

sudo apt update sudo aptitude update

After updating the package list of aptitude, install jfractionlab using the command aptitude install jfractionlab.

sudo aptitude -y install jfractionlab

How to Upgrade jfractionlab on debian

If you want to upgrade the jfractionlab package on your debian to its latest version then here’s how you can do that using apt, apt-get, aptitude, and synaptic.

Upgrade jfractionlab using Apt & Apt-get

To upgrade jfractionlab to its latest version using apt or apt-get, you will need to open the terminal then run the sudo apt update command to update the package list, after that copy and paste the commands given below to upgrade jfractionlab.

sudo apt install --only-upgrade jfractionlab sudo apt-get install --only-upgrade jfractionlab

Upgrade jfractionlab using Aptitude

To upgrade jfractionlab using aptitude you will need to again run the update command to update the package list, use command sudo aptitude update to do that. After that run the command given below to upgrade jfractionlab.

sudo aptitude -y full-upgrade jfractionlab

Upgrade jfractionlab using Synaptic

To upgrade jfractionlab using synaptic open synaptic using the command sudo synaptic or by going to the menu and searching for synaptic.

In synaptic click on the reload button, this will look for updates. After that you will need to search for jfractionlab, now right-click jfractionlab, and click on the mark for upgrade option.

Now to upgrade jfractionlab just click on the apply button, then click on the apply button again in the summary screen.

How To Uninstall jfractionlab on debian

If you want to remove and uninstall jfractionlab from your debian then here’s how you can do that. To remove just jfractionlab, you can use the command that is given below, copy the command, paste it in the command line then press enter.

sudo apt remove jfractionlab

Remove related packages, dependencies & configuration files of jfractionlab

To remove all the related packages, dependencies and configuration files of jfractionlab you can use the command given below.

sudo apt -y purge jfractionlab

Remove jfractionlab using Synaptic Package Manager

You can also uninstall jfractionlab using the synaptic package manager, first open synaptic using the command sudo synaptic or search and open it directly.

After that in synaptic search for jfractionlab, right-click the jfractionlab package and click on the Mark for Complete Removal option. Now to uninstall jfractionlab click on the apply button then in summary click on apply again.

Conclusion

That is how you can install jfractionlab on debian using the command line or using the synaptic package manager. I also showed you how you can uninstall and upgrade jfractionlab using the command line or using the synaptic package manager.

If you need any help regarding the installation of jfractionlab then send me a mail at netmikoblog@gmail.com, thank you.
